moves.name: Astonish
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Branch Poke
moves.desc: No additional effect.
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance lower adjacent Pkmn Speed by 1.

moves.name: Burning Jealousy
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to burn the target if it had a stat stage raised this turn.
moves.shortDesc: 100% burns a target that had a stat rise this turn.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.desc: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the user's Sp. Atk and Sp. Def by 1.

moves.name: Confuse Ray
moves.desc: Causes the target to become confused.
moves.shortDesc: Confuses the target.

moves.name: Curse
moves.desc: If the user is not a Ghost type, lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage and raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage. If the user is a Ghost type, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down and even if it would cause fainting, in exchange for the target losing 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn while it is active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue to be affected. Fails if there is no target or if the target is already affected.
moves.shortDesc: Curses if Ghost, else -1 Spe, +1 Atk, +1 Def.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Destiny Bond
moves.desc: Until the user's next move, if an opposing Pokemon's attack knocks the user out, that Pokemon faints as well, unless the attack was Doom Desire or Future Sight. Fails if the user used this move successfully as its last move, disregarding moves used through the Dancer Ability.
moves.shortDesc: If an opponent knocks out the user, it also faints.

moves.name: Dig
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Earthquake and Magnitude but takes double damage from them, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
moves.shortDesc: Digs underground turn 1, strikes turn 2.

moves.name: Drain Punch
moves.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
moves.shortDesc: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.desc: Damage doubles if the target is using Dig.
moves.shortDesc: Hits adjacent Pokemon. Double damage on Dig.

moves.name: Endure
moves.desc: The user will survive attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn with at least 1 HP. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Burning Bulwark, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
moves.shortDesc: User survives attacks this turn with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

moves.name: Facade
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned. The physical damage halving effect from the user's burn is ignored.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles if user is burn/poison/paralyzed.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

moves.name: Forest's Curse
moves.desc: Causes the Grass type to be added to the target, effectively making it have two or three types. Fails if the target is already a Grass type. If Trick-or-Treat adds a type to the target, it replaces the type added by this move and vice versa.
moves.shortDesc: Adds Grass to the target's type(s).

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.desc: Damage is calculated using the target's Attack stat, including stat stage changes. The user's Ability, item, and burn are used as normal.
moves.shortDesc: Uses target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
moves.shortDesc: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
moves.shortDesc: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.desc: This move's power is 20 if the target weighs less than 10 kg, 40 if less than 25 kg, 60 if less than 50 kg, 80 if less than 100 kg, 100 if less than 200 kg, and 120 if greater than or equal to 200 kg.
moves.shortDesc: More power the heavier the target.

moves.name: Grassy Glide
moves.desc: If the current terrain is Grassy Terrain and the user is grounded, this move has its priority increased by 1.
moves.shortDesc: User on Grassy Terrain: +1 priority.

moves.name: Grassy Terrain
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Grassy Terrain. During the effect, the power of Grass-type attacks used by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.3, the power of Bulldoze, Earthquake, and Magnitude used against grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 0.5, and grounded Pokemon have 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, restored at the end of each turn, including the last turn. Camouflage transforms the user into a Grass type, Nature Power becomes Energy Ball, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause sleep. Fails if the current terrain is Grassy Terrain.
moves.shortDesc: 5 turns. Grounded: +Grass power, +1/16 max HP.

moves.name: Growth
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage. If the weather is Sunny Day or Desolate Land, this move raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella, this move will only raise the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage, even if the weather is Sunny Day or Desolate Land.
moves.shortDesc: Raises user's Attack and Sp. Atk by 1; 2 in Sun.

moves.name: Haze
moves.desc: Resets the stat stages of all active Pokemon to 0.
moves.shortDesc: Eliminates all stat changes.

moves.name: Hex
moves.desc: Power doubles if the target has a non-volatile status condition.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles if the target has a status ailment.

moves.name: Horn Leech
moves.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
moves.shortDesc: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.
moves.shortDesc: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Imprison
moves.desc: The user prevents all opposing Pokemon from using any moves that the user also knows as long as the user remains active.
moves.shortDesc: No foe can use any move known by the user.

moves.name: Ingrain
moves.desc: The user has 1/16 of its maximum HP restored at the end of each turn, but it is prevented from switching out and other Pokemon cannot force the user to switch out. The user can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped and still receive the healing effect. During the effect, the user can be hit normally by Ground-type attacks and be affected by Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Sticky Web, even if the user is a Flying type or has the Levitate Ability.
moves.shortDesc: Traps/grounds user; heals 1/16 max HP per turn.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.desc: If the target is holding an item that can be removed from it, ignoring the Sticky Hold Ability, this move's power is multiplied by 1.5. If the user has not fainted, the target loses its held item. This move cannot cause Pokemon with the Sticky Hold Ability to lose their held item or cause a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, a Silvally, a Zacian, or a Zamazenta to lose their Blue Orb, Red Orb, Griseous Orb, Plate, Drive, Memory, Rusted Sword, or Rusted Shield respectively. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.
moves.shortDesc: 1.5x damage if foe holds an item. Removes item.

moves.name: Lash Out
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user had a stat stage lowered this turn.
moves.shortDesc: 2x power if the user had a stat lowered this turn.

moves.name: Leaf Storm
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Sp. Atk by 2.

moves.name: Leech Seed
moves.desc: The Pokemon at the user's position steals 1/8 of the target's maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn. If Big Root is held by the recipient, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue being leeched. If the target switches out or uses Mortal Spin or Rapid Spin successfully, the effect ends. Grass-type Pokemon are immune to this move on use, but not its effect.
moves.shortDesc: 1/8 of target's HP is restored to user every turn.

moves.name: Magical Leaf
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.
moves.shortDesc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Night Shade
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the user's level.
moves.shortDesc: Does damage equal to the user's level.

moves.name: Pain Split
moves.desc: The user and the target's HP become the average of their current HP, rounded down, but not more than the maximum HP of either one.
moves.shortDesc: Shares HP of user and target equally.

moves.name: Phantom Force
moves.desc: If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
moves.shortDesc: Disappears turn 1. Hits turn 2. Breaks protection.

moves.name: Poison Jab
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Poltergeist
moves.desc: Fails if the target has no held item.
moves.shortDesc: Fails if the target has no held item.

moves.name: Protect
moves.desc: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Burning Bulwark, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
moves.shortDesc: Prevents moves from affecting the user this turn.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

moves.name: Psychic Noise
moves.desc: For 2 turns, the target is prevented from restoring any HP as long as it remains active. During the effect, healing and draining moves are unusable, and Abilities and items that grant healing will not heal the user. If an affected Pokemon uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to restore its HP. Pain Split and the Regenerator Ability are unaffected.
moves.shortDesc: For 2 turns, the target is prevented from healing.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.desc: The user copies all of the target's current stat stage changes.
moves.shortDesc: Copies the target's current stat stages.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Rain Dance. The damage of Water-type attacks is multiplied by 1.5 and the damage of Fire-type attacks is multiplied by 0.5 during the effect. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Damp Rock. Fails if the current weather is Rain Dance.
moves.shortDesc: For 5 turns, heavy rain powers Water moves.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the user and its party members take 0.5x damage from physical attacks, or 0.66x damage if in a Double Battle. Damage is not reduced further with Aurora Veil. Critical hits ignore this effect. It is removed from the user's side if the user or an ally is successfully hit by Brick Break, Psychic Fangs, or Defog. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Light Clay. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
moves.shortDesc: For 5 turns, physical damage to allies is halved.

moves.name: Rest
moves.desc: The user falls asleep for the next two turns and restores all of its HP, curing itself of any non-volatile status condition in the process. Fails if the user has full HP, is already asleep, or if another effect is preventing sleep.
moves.shortDesc: User sleeps 2 turns and restores HP and status.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the foe(s) flinch.

moves.name: Scary Face
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Speed by 2.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.desc: No additional effect.
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

moves.name: Shadow Claw
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
moves.shortDesc: High critical hit ratio.

moves.name: Skill Swap
moves.desc: The user swaps its Ability with the target's Ability. Fails if either the user or the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Embody Aspect, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Poison Puppeteer, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Tera Shell, Tera Shift, Teraform Zero, Wonder Guard, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.
moves.shortDesc: The user and the target trade Abilities.

moves.name: Skitter Smack
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower target's Sp. Atk by 1.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.desc: One of the user's known moves, besides this move, is selected for use at random. Fails if the user is not asleep. The selected move does not have PP deducted from it, and can currently have 0 PP. This move cannot select Assist, Beak Blast, Belch, Bide, Blazing Torque, Celebrate, Chatter, Combat Torque, Copycat, Dynamax Cannon, Focus Punch, Hold Hands, Magical Torque, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Noxious Torque, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Uproar, Wicked Torque, or any two-turn move.
moves.shortDesc: User must be asleep. Uses another known move.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. Power is halved if the weather is Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, or Snow and the user is not holding Utility Umbrella. If the user is holding a Power Herb or the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, the move completes in one turn. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella and the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, the move still requires a turn to charge.
moves.shortDesc: Charges turn 1. Hits turn 2. No charge in sunlight.

moves.name: Spite
moves.desc: Causes the target's last move used to lose 4 PP. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if it no longer knows the move.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the PP of the target's last move by 4.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.desc: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it, or if the user switches out or faints. Baton Pass can be used to transfer the substitute to an ally, and the substitute will keep its remaining HP. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by other Pokemon. Sound-based moves and Pokemon with the Infiltrator Ability ignore substitutes. The user still takes normal damage from weather and status effects while behind its substitute. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the user will take damage from any remaining hits. If a substitute is created while the user is trapped by a binding move, the binding effect ends immediately. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute without fainting, or if it already has a substitute.
moves.shortDesc: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a substitute.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Sunny Day. The damage of Fire-type attacks is multiplied by 1.5 and the damage of Water-type attacks is multiplied by 0.5 during the effect. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Heat Rock. Fails if the current weather is Sunny Day.
moves.shortDesc: For 5 turns, intense sunlight powers Fire moves.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.desc: No additional effect.
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Tera Blast
moves.desc: If the user is Terastallized, this move becomes a physical attack if the user's Attack is greater than its Special Attack, including stat stage changes, and this move's type becomes the same as the user's Tera Type. In addition, if the user's Tera Type is Stellar, this move has 100 power, is super effective against Terastallized targets and neutral against other targets, and lowers the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: If Terastallized: Phys. if Atk > SpA, type = Tera.

moves.name: Thief
moves.desc: If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Z-Crystal, or if the target is a Kyogre holding a Blue Orb, a Groudon holding a Red Orb, a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb, an Arceus holding a Plate, a Genesect holding a Drive, a Silvally holding a Memory, or a Pokemon that can Mega Evolve holding the Mega Stone for its species. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.
moves.shortDesc: If the user has no item, it steals the target's.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.desc: Badly poisons the target. If a Poison-type Pokemon uses this move, the target cannot avoid the attack, even if the target is in the middle of a two-turn move.
moves.shortDesc: Badly poisons the target. Poison types can't miss.

moves.name: Trailblaze
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1.

moves.name: Trick
moves.desc: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.
moves.shortDesc: User switches its held item with the target's.

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the Speed of every Pokemon is recalculated for the purposes of determining turn order. During the effect, each Pokemon's Speed is considered to be (10000 - its normal Speed), and if this value is greater than 8191, 8192 is subtracted from it. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.
moves.shortDesc: Goes last. For 5 turns, turn order is reversed.

moves.name: Will-O-Wisp
moves.desc: Burns the target.
moves.shortDesc: Burns the target.

moves.name: Wood Hammer
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 33% recoil.

moves.name: X-Scissor
moves.desc: No additional effect.
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.
